‘Bear-market blues’ test mettle of most devout Bitcoin holdersBitcoin, down about 20% this week, fell to as low as $21,932 on Tuesday, putting it squarely below the average investor cost base of $23,500, according to UBS. That means prices have declined enough to test even long-term holders, who up until now in the 2022 drawdown were largely in the green with their investments.
Bitcoin falls to fresh 18-month low as crypto meltdown deepens
Crypto giant Binance opens 2,000 positions for hiring: CEO Changpeng Zhao

Bitcoin plunges as major crypto lender halts operationsBitcoin was trading at roughly $22,400 late Monday, down more than 16% in the past day. Ethereum, another widely followed cryptocurrency, was down roughly 17%. Investors have been selling riskier assets such as digital currencies and technology stocks as the Federal Reserve raises interest rates to combat high inflation.
